021
022
023
024import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
025import static org.junit.Assert.assertFalse;
026import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
027import static org.junit.Assert.fail;
028import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertInstanceOf;
029
030import org.apache.turbine.modules.scheduledjobs.SimpleJob;
031import org.apache.turbine.services.TurbineServices;
032import org.apache.turbine.util.TurbineConfig;
033import org.apache.turbine.util.TurbineException;
034import org.junit.After;
035import org.junit.Before;
036import org.junit.Test;
037
038/**
039 * Unit testing for the non-persistent implementation of the scheduler service.
040 *
041 * @author <a href="mailto:quintonm@bellsouth.net">Quinton McCombs</a>
042 * @version $Id: TurbineNonPersistentSchedulerServiceTest.java 615328 2008-01-25 20:25:05Z tv $
043 */
044public class TurbineNonPersistentSchedulerServiceTest
045{
046    private TurbineConfig tc = null;
047
048    private ScheduleService scheduler = null;
049
050    @Before
051    public void setUp() throws Exception
052    {
053        tc =
054            new TurbineConfig(
055                ".",
056                "/conf/test/TurbineNonPersistentSchedulerServiceTest.properties");
057        tc.initialize();
058
059        scheduler = (ScheduleService)TurbineServices.getInstance().getService(ScheduleService.SERVICE_NAME);
060    }
061
062    @After
063    public void tearDown() throws Exception
064    {
065        if (tc != null)
066        {
067            tc.dispose();
068        }
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Tests the ability to enable and disable the service.
073     */
074    @Test public void testEnableDisable()
075    {
076        try
077        {
078            scheduler.startScheduler();
079            assertTrue(scheduler.isEnabled());
080
081            scheduler.stopScheduler();
082            assertFalse(scheduler.isEnabled());
083        }
084        catch (Exception e)
085        {
086            e.printStackTrace();
087            fail();
088        }
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Tests the ability to add and remove a job.  A list of jobs will be obtained from
093     * the service to determine if the operation were successful.
094     */
095    @Test public void testAddRemoveJob()
096    {
097        try
098        {
099            // get the current job count for later comparison
100            int jobCount = scheduler.listJobs().size();
101
102            // Add a new job entry
103            JobEntry je = scheduler.newJob(0, 1, -1, -1, -1, "SimpleJob");
104
105            scheduler.addJob(je);
106            assertEquals(jobCount + 1, scheduler.listJobs().size());
107
108            assertTrue(scheduler.listJobs().contains( je ));
109            scheduler.removeJob(je);
110            assertTrue(!scheduler.listJobs().contains( je ));
111            assertEquals(jobCount, scheduler.listJobs().size());
112
113        }
114        catch (Exception e)
115        {
116            e.printStackTrace();
117            fail();
118        }
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Tests the ability to retrieve the job added during initialization.
123     */
124    @Test public void testGetJob()
125    {
126        try
127        {
128                        JobEntry je = scheduler.getJob(1);
129                        assertInstanceOf(JobEntryNonPersistent.class, je);
130                        JobEntryNonPersistent jenp = (JobEntryNonPersistent)je;
131            assertEquals(1, jenp.getJobId());
132            assertEquals(1, jenp.getSecond());
133            assertEquals(-1, jenp.getMinute());
134            assertEquals(-1, jenp.getHour());
135            assertEquals(-1, jenp.getDayOfMonth());
136            assertEquals(-1, jenp.getWeekDay());
137            assertEquals("SimpleJob", jenp.getTask());
138        }
139        catch (TurbineException e)
140        {
141            e.printStackTrace();
142            fail();
143        }
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Test to make sure a job actually runs.
148     */
149    @Test public void testRunningJob()
150    {
151        try
152        {
153           int beforeCount = SimpleJob.getCounter();
154           Thread.sleep(1600);// expect at least less than about two seconds
155           int afterCount = SimpleJob.getCounter();
156           assertTrue(beforeCount + " should be before " + afterCount, beforeCount < afterCount);
157
158        }
159        catch (Exception e)
160        {
161            e.printStackTrace();
162            fail();
163        }
164    }
165
166}
